_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Semiconductor and Other Electronic Component Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary    

In order to comply with the Risk Management Program regulations, 40 CFR Part 68, mandated under the accidental release provisions of the Clean Air Act Amendments of 1990,  International Business Machines Corporation (IBM) is submitting this Risk Management Plan for the East Fishkill Facility.

Hydrogen is currently the only substance which is stored in a quantity greater than the reporting threshold and required to be included in this submission.   Hydrogen is currently stored in two separate locations within the facility.

A Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) is conducted on a five year schedule by the Process Hazard Analysis Team.  The PHA team is comprised of Gas Engineer (team leader), Safety representative for gases, Gas Technician, manufacturing representatives from site manufacturing organizations, Emergency Control representative, and an engineer from Air Products (Vendor).  The results are recorded and maintained on file.

Operating procedures were written by the Gas Engineer using technical process descriptions and process safety information, and with input from the involved employees.  Operating procedures, as specified in the Process Safety Management (PSM) Documentation for the Hydrogen System, are available from Site Systems Engineering (D/20G) and Utility Plant and Bulk Gas operations (D/88B).  The operating procedures are documented as Bulk Gas Procedures or as Desk References, and are available in B/316. 

Training is formulated and tracked by the Gas Engineer and training records are maintained by D/20G and D/88B managers.

Mechanical Integrity is shared between the gas supplier and IBM.  The program consists of equipment lists and specifications, equipment history, and preventative maintenance procedures.

Hot work permits for work on the  hydrogen system are issued by IBM (Emergency Control) or Air Products.  This permit issuing process includes a safety inspection of  the area.

Quality assurance of the Management of Change (MOC)

program is provided  by the Hydrogen  Storage Process Safety Management Owner.  The MOC is composed of a written program with elements delegated to appropriate members of the PSM team.  A copy of the documentation is maintained for the life of the process.

Quality assurance of the pre-startup review program is provided by the Hydrogen Storage  Process Safety Management Owner.   Documentation is maintained as part the MOC program.

Incident investigation program follows the IBM incident report procedure in the Safety & Health Manual Index 04-01-04A for fact determination, root cause analysis and recommendation implementation.
